pros: -Flexible Hours -Good level of guidance from management

pros: It provides you with a lot of opportunities to learn management, administration, marketing, mentoring and crisis management.
cons: There's no limits of care outlined in the university.

pros: -Great team - Lots of bonuses -Points system is a great incentive

pros: Chill work environment not too stressful if you don't mind talking alot.

review_title: Security job at St Francis Xavier university on-campus pub
pros: Good hours around class/study time.
cons: Hours of work always conflicted with social time.

job_title: Box Office Clerk in Antigonish, NS
pros: Flexible scheduling. The job was not demanding, and as a student you were able to complete assignments during non busy hours.
cons: Sometimes busy hours were overwhelming during peak times - however this is extremely rare.

pros: A relaxed environment where there is no pressure on research outcomes or so.

pros: the quality of life for the area is incredible

pros: Good pay and experience for future employment.
cons: Not any really. Small workload relative to pay

pros: flexible hours, good teammates, sometimes free food

pros: Accommodating, good management, incentives provided
cons: tedious, repetitive, some difficult phone calls

review_title: Excellent community spirit but low work-life balance
pros:
University is located in a very small rural community, where people are friendly and close. It offers a unique opportunity to explore research in remote, underserved locations.
The university has a strong social lens (historically) to its activities and values that type of research, too.
cons:
University is located in a very small rural community, so there is little opportunity for collaboration around, unless with other small universities. Few organizations or associations.
Being an undergraduate-focused university, all the research is crammed in the summer and can be tough for new scholars/faculty to build their research program.
No graduate student to support professors means that everything in research, teaching, and service falls under the professors themselves with little to no support, making work-life balance very difficult.
Students often have attitudes that demonstrate feelings of entitlement.
The community research is very tight knit and may be difficult to start collaborations. Feelt rather competitive at times, instead of supportive.

job_title: Contact Centre Representative in Antigonish, NS
pros: The best part of this position is that it gave me experience as a customer service representative while attending university. The schedule is pretty flexible and management is very supportive of newer employees.
cons: Because you are the face of the technology support group, people tend to think that you should be able to solve all of their tech problems, when in reality there is little training. The pay is also only minimum wage

review_title: StFX provides a great opportunity for students working part time as student police to maintain safety of the campus.
pros:
It gives you team management skill and crisis control experience. 
Certificate of Emergency Aid with CPR is mandatory which is helpful in case it is needed for further jobs.
cons: Shifts can go till 3 in the morning on a school day which can be sometimes tiring.

pros: The students look to you for advice and generally respect you.
cons: Some staff have been there for a very long time and are stuck in their old ways and not wanting to change things.
